instruction: Fill a large pot with enough water to comfortably cover the linguine. Add a generous pinch of salt (or 1 tablespoon) and bring the water to a rolling boil over high heat.
If using, add a tablespoon of olive oil to the boiling water to prevent sticking (optional).
Carefully add the linguine to the boiling water. Use tongs to separate any strands that clump together.
Stir the linguine occasionally to prevent sticking, especially during the first few minutes of cooking.
Cook the linguine according to the package instructions, typically for 8-12 minutes, or until al dente (slightly firm to the bite).
Reserve about 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining.
Drain the linguine in a colander.
Immediately return the drained linguine to the pot and toss with your favorite sauce. Add a splash or two of reserved pasta water to create a smooth and saucy consistency (optional).
